23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: It's done. The Netherbrain is defeated - along with the Grand Design, praise Mother Gith.
23.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, swam to shore, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *Almost as an afterthought, you notice you lost the powers Mizora gave you. But it doesn't matter anymore. You've never felt so potent.*
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll look himself over, feeling the eldrich energies leaving his body.

2.speaker: Lae'zel
2.text: I should feel relieved, yet my blood still simmers...

4.speaker: Karlach
4.context: NodeContext: vocal equivalent of a sad smile

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: I saved the fucking world. And I think I might live long enough to tell the tale, too.

35.speaker: Karlach
35.context: NodeContext: vocal equivalent of a sad smile

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I wish I'd made the sacrifice instead of you, Karlach.

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: Don't worry about me. I'm... happy.

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *Against all odds, the Netherbrain is defeated. The day, won. The future of Faerûn, secured.*
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the bay where the brain sank.

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *All it took was becoming a mind flayer.*
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks at front and back of their illithid hand.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: ...The parasite. It's withered, dead along with the Netherbrain. I am cleansed! I will never be a filthy ghaik.

45.speaker: Shadowheart
45.text: I can't feel the tadpole... they must have all died with the brain - that means we can't turn into mind flayers!
45.context: NodeContext: Realisation and delight - she's finally free of the parasite.

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: And here I was worried I'd become some grotesque, deformed beast.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: And we didn't even have to turn into mind flayers to do it!

0.speaker: Gale
0.text: Against all odds, we cured ourselves. Free from the parasite. Free from the prospect of ceremorphosis. I can hardly believe it. We will not become accursed illithids!

31.speaker: Wyll
31.text: My mind is clear, its burden lifted. When the Netherbrain died, the tadpoles died with it.
31.context: NodeContext: like waking up from a nightmare to a delightful reality

20.speaker: Wyll
20.text: When the Netherbrain died, the tadpoles died with it. I'll never be some grotesque illithid!
20.context: NodeContext: like waking up from a nightmare to a delightful reality

7.speaker: Halsin
7.text: The tadpoles must have died with the brain. The threat of ceremorphosis is no more.

14.speaker: Jaheira
14.text: And the tadpoles have fallen silent, I take it? Good. A mind flayer wouldn't make for much of a heroic statue.

15.speaker: Minsc
15.text: And the worm squirms no more! Boo need not worry that his seat on my skull will grow suddenly stickier with mind flayer juice.
15.context: NodeContext: Joyous - happily saying he will no longer turn into a mind flayer

43.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
43.text: And we are cleansed. The tadpoles are still, at last - they cannot control us, or turn us into abominations.

16.speaker: Shadowheart
16.text: We did it. The Netherbrain is dead.

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: We're free of that stupid parasite. And I'm free to enjoy all the power Cazador left me.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: And I'm still standing in the sun. This is incredible! Maybe whatever it changed in me was permanent?

32.speaker: Wyll
32.text: The city will cheer us - but it is the triumph itself, the very smiting of evil, that should lift our hearts.
32.context: NodeContext: his nobility barely masking his joy at such triumph

58.speaker: Karlach
58.context: NodeContext: Still in high spirits but Karlach starting to flag; she's not feeling great (will die soon, but still on her feet for now).

42.speaker: Halsin
42.text: Hard to believe we have actually prevailed. But it is true.

22.speaker: Jaheira
22.text: We've won, but at what cost? The mangled rhymes the bards will make of your name - perhaps those are the true evil here.
22.context: NodeContext: Mock horror - actually willing to joke now the day has been won

59.speaker: Minsc
59.text: Boo did not doubt us for a moment. Not during any of our many failures.
59.context: NodeContext: Satisfied, taking in the scene of our victory

30.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
30.text: We are free. No more gods or monsters except those of our own making.

36.speaker: Wyll
36.text: My powers... they're draining. Just like Mizora said they would. A small price to pay, in the grand scheme of things.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: It's done. The Netherbrain is defeated - along with the Grand Design, Vlaakith be praised.
27.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, swam to shore, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

49.speaker: Shadowheart
49.text: Hells. I'm lucky I learned to swim when I did...
49.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, swam to shore, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

28.speaker: Shadowheart
28.text: Ugh... should've learned to bloody swim. Can't believe I almost drowned at the last hurdle...
28.context: NodeContext: Spoken with a cough/splutter/weeze after nearly drowning

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: Ha! Victory! Our enemies are dust at our feet.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: I - I can't feel the tadpole. It's gone - we're free!

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: Take a moment, savour our victory. Long may the coastwinds carry our names.
12.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: The loss of a mind is a terrible thing... but this time, I think I'll make an exception.
48.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, swam to shore, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

1.speaker: Karlach
1.text: We did it. We actually did it. And the city's still standing.
1.context: NodeContext: Stunned relief. Karlach starting to flag; she's not feeling great (will die soon, but still on her feet for now).

38.speaker: Halsin
38.text: The final blow has been struck. The battle is surely won.
38.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, swam to shore, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

61.speaker: Jaheira
61.text: Well, this is a bigger mess than any we made in the old days. My congratulations.
61.context: NodeContext: Exhausted, but appraising the ruined city skyline after we saved the city. She's not being sarcastic - actually impressed.

41.speaker: Minsc
41.text: No, Boo - this moment is for savouring. There will be tadpoles to snack on later.
41.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a squeak from Boo. Stage whisper, a little harried - Boo's ruining what is meant to be a moment of reflection as you and the party stand and stare at the ruined - but saved! - skyline of Baldur's Gate

19.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
19.text: It is done - the Absolute eradicated, vengeance exacted.
